I'm glad that Riot kept emphasizing that Poppy is the person that gives the hammer its power. I'm kinda sick of people always saying characters that get a magical or powerful weapon are only strong because of that weapon.

Yes there can be great weapons, in history there were many famous blacksmiths that created well known and admired weapons of great quality, but it also took skilled and experienced warriors to wield those weapons to their full potential. A skilled fighter with a large stick can beat a novice with a sword.

Though nothing is more dangerous to a master swordsman than a novice swordsman.  Mostly because they do not know what they're doing.  

I'm curious how exactly she gives the hammer its power.  Maybe through her soul?
Probably with her arms.

BLOMGRUN'S ;^;
 IT'S BLOMGRUN'S.
 Her search for vengeance has become a search for validation.

 She knew EXACTLY whose it was. It was her father's. Her father that she watched die in front of her as she sat unable to help, hidden away in the brush. Her father, whose blood she saw spill from his throat as those filthy Noxian assassin bastards ripped away her beloved family, mentor, and friend. 

Her father-- whose prized work she carried alone to the capital city to deliver, and then refused payment because "No price could ever repay her father's life."

 It was her father's forger, and with every blow she dealt to Noxian flesh she exacted her father's revenge through it. Through her life, she repaid them for his death. It was already HER power-- that used such a "small" hammer to unleash such devastation. It was HER, SHE was the skilled warrior.

 The Hammer means nothing now to her but that she has to babysit it because she has to find out who it belongs to.
She was TASKED with carrying around because she has to find SOME GUY. "Oh well, guess I'll find him in the next village" my a**.

Yo! Fuck your logic, ok?
And Lee Sin/Jax/Kat were never meant to ward hop...
Where in the world does it say that?

Riot has said (many a time) that ward hopping was not intended. But by the time they got to the point to fix it, it had become iconic on those champions so they just left it in. If Braum were released near Lee Sin, then Braum's ally hop would have been a ward hop as well.
They've specifically said that they didn't put it on Braum because it doesn't fit him.

Yes... but my point is/was when Lee/Jax/Kat were made the coding prevented them from preventing a champion to jump to wards. (ie everything coded as a minion) That's why if Braum were made THEN, he would have ward hopped because of their coding.

Am I not explaining this well enough?
Yup. But OFC Riot can admit that, but won't remove it....And people wonder why Kat/Jax/Lee never really leave the meta....Could be added little utility things like this....Just maybe.
